body.p:
Paducah Ky July 7" 1861
To his Excellency
Beriah Magoffin
Respected sir

At the present Term of the McCracken Equity & Criminal ^Court^ there was a Judgment rendered against Peter C Smedly for one Hundred Dollars on a forted ^forfeited^ recognisance -- There was two Dutchman arrested for cutting a man one Smedly went ^on^ Peter Telons bail, and Telon went to Indiana. and Smedley never has heard of him the other Dutchman that was arrested at the same time with Telon and for the same offence was tried and sent to the Penitentiary when he is now, the Evidence clearly showed that Telon was clear with these facts and the Exceeding scarcity of Money Mr Smedly though will ask Executive
Clemency, the foregoing are the facts in the case, If you should conclude to release Mr Smedley send the release to P. C. Smedly at Paducah Ky

Yours very Respectfully &
Thos H Corbett

McCracken Eq Ct
$100 } Recog
P. C. Smedley
